pullRequest.body:
`List.destutter` behaves nicely when the condition is a _cotransitive_ relation, and even better when it's a _coequivalence_ relation. This proves that behavior.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Part of #9052.

nodes.body: Alright, I dropped the "Coequivalence" and "Cotransitive" stuff; now everything uses `compl`. I added an instance for `NEq` to get the right stuff going. Also adding the `destutter_map_inj` for injective maps.
I removed the dependence on #9081 since it's not using any of that code now.
I don't have time to review this any further but I was globally happy with it during my last review. So whoever takes over reviewing should only look for local issues.
@urkud other stuff this needs?
@YaelDillies do you know who else could review this? Other PRs are still blocked by it and it's been several months.
I'm sorry for the delay. I'm going to merge `master` and fix compile now, then review it tonight or tomorrow.
Wow sorry, this completely fell off my radar. I guess I will wait for Yury to merge master, but yes we should get that in!
Lightly bumping this @urkud :) If you don't have time, I can try to find time to update to master, but it won't be for a bit

</details>

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Chain.length_le_length_destutter`
`+ Ne.instIsEquiv_compl`
`+ Sublist.length_destutter'_mono`
`+ Sublist.of_cons_of_ne`
`+ ext_get!`
`+ getD_replicate`

`+ length_destutter_cons_ge_length_destutter`

`+ map_destutter`
`+ map_destutter_ne`

</details>

I've added the "proper" depending relation - the bot should now do a little bit of work for you!

A few comments, I think the rest of the docstrings should be edited in similar ways too.

Thanks for all this! Contributing to Mathlib for the first time is hard and long sometimes, but we really appreciate it :)

cc @YaelDillies so you can see where `IsCoequiv` is used

```suggestion
/-- `destutter'` always has length at least 1. -/
```
and similar through the file

```suggestion
theorem length_destutter'_pos : 0 < (destutter' R a l).length := by
```

```suggestion
/-- For a relation-preserving map, `destutter'` commutes with `map`. -/
```

@YaelDillies, should there be a version for `RelHom`?
Probably not. We should just state this for injective maps because I doubt we care about any other relation than `≠`.
This is great! I think the docstring is the wrong place for it - I'd sprinkle it in through the proof.

```suggestion
theorem map_destutter_ne {f : α → β} (h : Function.Injective f) [DecidableEq α] [DecidableEq β] :
```
Also feel free to `open Function` at the top to be able to write
```suggestion
theorem map_destutter_ne {f : α → β} (h : Injective f) [DecidableEq α] [DecidableEq β] :
```

```suggestion
theorem length_destutter' [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] (hab : ¬R a b) :
```

```suggestion
theorem le_length_destutter' [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] :
    (List.destutter' R b l).length ≤ (List.destutter' R a (b :: l)).length := by
```
Swapped this and similar inequalities

```suggestion
    by_cases hac : R a c
```
and swap the two branches

This actually doesn't easily work. Using the `Rᶜ a c` is a deliberate choice because it helps the typeclass inference realize that we're talking about `Rᶜ` instead of just `R`, and lets it find the relevant `trans Rᶜ`. With `by_cases hac : R a c`, the `neg` branch gets `¬R a c` which doesn't work with the typeclass inference like `Rᶜ a c` does. Of course you can get around this but it adds several lines of noise. (Maybe there's a super-easy transparent way that I'm missing.)

You can always do
```
obtain hac | hac : R a c ∨ Rᶜ a c := em _
```
Alrighty, changed this

Why not just
```suggestion
    · have hbc : ¬Rᶜ b c := mt (_root_.trans hab) (not_not.2 hac)
      simp [destutter', if_pos hac, if_pos (not_not.1 hbc)]
    · have hbc : ¬R b c := trans (symm hab) hac
```
Done, also dropped an extra couple `Classical.`s

```suggestion
theorem Sublist.of_cons_of_ne {a b} (h₁ : a ≠ b) (h₂ : a :: l₁ <+ b :: l₂) : a :: l₁ <+ l₂ := by
```

```suggestion
theorem getD_replicate {y i n} (h : i < n) :
```

```suggestion
theorem destutter'_ne_nil : destutter' R a l ≠ [] = by
```
is the more canonical spelling

Alright! So it turns out `destutter'_ne_nil` already exists so I just changed my one usage,
`exact length_destutter'_pos _ _`
into
`List.length_pos_of_ne_nil (destutter'_ne_nil _ _)`

```suggestion
theorem map_destutter (f : α → β) (h : ∀ a b, R a b ↔ R₂ (f a) (f b)) :
```

```suggestion
  map_destutter l _ f fun _ _ ↦ h.ne_iff.symm
```

Just FYI your `destutter'` won't turn into a link in the docs unless you "fully qualify" the name:
```suggestion
/-- `List.destutter'` on a relation like `≠`, whose negation is an equivalence, gives the same
length if the first elements are not related. -/
```
Also, docstrings end with `-/`, not `--/`. Be careful! Else you'll end up with docstrings with a trailing `-`.

```suggestion
    (destutter' R a l).length = (destutter' R b l).length := by
```
or
```suggestion
    (l.destutter' R a).length = (l.destutter' R b).length := by
```

```suggestion
theorem length_destutter'_congr [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] (hab : ¬R a b) :
```
sounds more accurate
Does this used twice not imply ` length_destutter'` straightforwardly?
It is, good point. Changed

```suggestion
theorem length_destutter_ne_cons_ge_length_destutter [DecidableEq α] :
```

Can you generalise that to
```suggestion
theorem Suffix.length_destutter'_mono [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] (h : a :: l₁ <:+ b :: l₂) :
    (List.destutter' R a l₁).length ≤ (List.destutter' R b l₂).length := by
```

I think that's a correct statement as written, but it would probably just be an induction with `le_length_destutter'` as the inductive step. I don't really know anything about `Suffix` and I'm not super motivated to dive into that atm, so I hope it's alright I skip this one.

Mind leaving 
```suggestion
/-
TODO: Replace this lemma by the more general version:
theorem Sublist.length_destutter'_mono [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] (h : a :: l₁ <+ b :: l₂) :
    (List.destutter' R a l₁).length ≤ (List.destutter' R b l₂).length
-/
theorem le_length_destutter' [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] :
    (List.destutter' R b l).length ≤ (List.destutter' R a (b :: l)).length := by
```

This is a completely unguessable name. Maybe
```suggestion
theorem Chain.length_le_length_destutter [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] (h₁ : l₂ <+ l) (h₂ : l₂.Chain' R) :
    l₂.length ≤ (l.destutter R).length := by
```
Thanks. I have just barely enough intuition to guess names sometimes myself. I recognized this name was unguessable, but had no idea how to name it myself. :)

```suggestion
Authors: Leonardo de Moura
```
Is this not already inferred?
Oh. I guess it is. I was struggling to get things with complements to work, and it seemed like this was necessary at the time ... but running it now, it doesn't seem to be. Will cut it out.

```suggestion
instance Ne.instIsEquiv_compl : IsEquiv α (· ≠ ·)ᶜ := by
```

Something like
```suggestion
  convert eq_isEquiv α; simp
```
Turns out `simp [compl]` works.
We have `getD_eq_get`
done

```suggestion
theorem le_length_destutter'_cons [IsEquiv α Rᶜ] :
```

pullRequest.title: feat: `List.destutter` on cotransitive relations.

source.title: Lemmas for Descartes' Rule of Signs. Notably `coeffList` and `IsCoequiv` as new defs.
